title: QUIC: Missing implementation of SocketQUICStream_transition_recv()
body:
## Summary

The function `SocketQUICStream_transition_recv()` is declared in the header file but not implemented in the source file.

## Details

- **File**: `src/quic/SocketQUICStream.c`
- **Header Declaration**: `include/quic/SocketQUICStream.h:455`
- **Severity**: CRITICAL
- **Pattern**: MISSING_IMPLEMENTATION

## Impact

This is a core state machine function for QUIC stream management. Any code attempting to transition the receive-side state machine will fail at link time with an undefined reference error.

## Expected Implementation

Based on the header documentation (line 436-456), this function should:
- Implement the receiving part of the stream state machine per RFC 9000 Section 3.2
- Handle state transitions:
  - Recv → SizeKnown (on RECV_FIN)
  - Recv → ResetRecvd (on RECV_RESET)
  - SizeKnown → DataRecvd (on ALL_DATA_RECVD)
  - SizeKnown → ResetRecvd (on RECV_RESET)
  - DataRecvd → DataRead (on APP_READ_DATA)
  - ResetRecvd → ResetRead (on APP_READ_RESET)
- Return `QUIC_STREAM_OK` on success
- Return `QUIC_STREAM_ERROR_STATE` on invalid transition

## Recommended Fix

Implement the state machine in `src/quic/SocketQUICStream.c` following RFC 9000 Section 3.2.

## References

- RFC 9000 Section 3.2 (Receiving Part)
- Related: SocketQUICStream structure has `recv_state` field and `SocketQUICStreamEvent` enum defines events
